@roblox/globaltype/Trail.MaxLength.documentation: Sets the maximum length of the trail.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.MinLength.documentation: Minimum length of a trail's segment in studs.
@roblox/globaltype/Trail.MinLength.code_sample:
local trail = script.Parent
 
trail.Lifetime = 4
 
while wait(3) do
    trail.MinLength = 10
    wait(3)
    trail.MinLength = 0.1
end

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Texture.documentation: The texture to display on the trail.
@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Texture.code_sample:
local trail = script.Parent
local textureId = "rbxassetid://909814149"
trail.Texture = textureId

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.TextureLength.documentation: Sets length of texture if Trail.TextureMode is Wrap or Static. If mode is Stretch sets number of times texture will repeat.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.TextureMode.documentation: Sets how the Texture will be drawn.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Transparency.documentation: Sets the transparency of the Trail's segments over the trail's Trail.Lifetime.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.WidthScale.documentation: A DataType.NumberSequence that scales the width of the Trail over the course of its lifetime.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Clear/param/0.documentation: The Trail object is used to create a trail like effect between two points.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Clear.documentation: Clears the segments of the trail.

@roblox/globaltype/Translator.documentation: The role of a Translator is to manufacture/return strings localized for the viewing player

@roblox/globaltype/Translator.FormatByKe.documentation: The role of a Translator is to manufacture/return strings localized for the viewing player
The Key value to look up and translate.

If the Source text and translations contain articles/localization format strings|format strings, a Lua table of values or key-value pairs, depending on whether the format strings are numbered or named.
Returns the localized text string in a LocalizationTable based on its Translator locale, by key.

@roblox/globaltype/Translator.Translate/.documentation: The role of a Translator is to manufacture/return strings localized for the viewing player
A valid in-game Instance to use for context override as outlined above. Note that this argument can be arbitrary, for example game, if you don't require a context override.
The Source text to look up and translate.

@roblox/globaltype/Translator.Translate.documentation: Returns the localized text string in a LocalizationTable based on its Translator locale, by source lookup.

@roblox/globaltype/TremoloSoundEffect.documentation: Creates a trembling effect on a sound by varying the volume of the sound up and down.

@roblox/globaltype/TremoloSoundEffect.De.documentation: Controls how much the volume will raise and lower.

@roblox/globaltype/TremoloSoundEffect.Du.documentation: Controls how long during one volume oscillation the effect will be active.

@roblox/globaltype/TremoloSoundEffect.Fr.documentation: Sets how often the effect will oscillate the volume.

@roblox/globaltype/TriangleMeshPart.documentation:
Classe intermédiaire abstraite qui gère les propriétés physiques de la géométrie pour
PartOperations et MeshParts.

@roblox/globaltype/TriangleMeshPart.Coll.documentation: Détermine le niveaupart de détail de la physique du maillage.

@roblox/globaltype/TrussPart.documentation: Les pièces de treillis sont les mêmes que Part, sauf qu'elles ont un style visuel, redimensionnez différemment et les personnages sont capables de les escalader.

@roblox/globaltype/TrussPart.Style.documentation:
Définit à quoi ressemble la structure. Il existe actuellement trois
styles.

@roblox/globaltype/Tween.documentation: Les interpolations sont utilisées pour interpoler les propriétés des instances. L'Tweenobjet contrôle lui-même la lecture de l'interpolation. Création et configuration les interpolations se font avec la fonction TweenService:Create. C'est la seule façon pour créer des préadolescents. Instance.new ne peut pas être utilisé pour cet objet particulier.
@roblox/globaltype/Tween.code_sample:
local TweenService = game:GetService("TweenService")
 
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 10, 0)
part.Color = Color3.new(1, 0, 0)
part.Anchored = true
part.Parent = game.Workspace
 
local goal = {}
goal.Position = Vector3.new(10, 10, 0)
goal.Color = Color3.new(0, 1, 0)
 
local tweenInfo = TweenInfo.new(5)
 
local tween = TweenService:Create(part, tweenInfo, goal)
 
tween:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/Tween.Instance.documentation: La propriété Instance en lecture seule d'unTween ` pointe surInstance` dont les propriétés sont interpolées par l'interpolation.
@roblox/globaltype/Tween.Instance.code_sample:
local function isInstanceAPart(tween)
	local instance = tween.Instance
	return instance:IsA("BasePart")
end

@roblox/globaltype/Tween.TweenInfo.documentation: Propriété en lecture seule qui inclut des informations sur la manière dont l'interpolation de leTween `doit être effectué en utilisant le type de donnéesTweenInfo`.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.documentation: Classe de base abstraite pour les gestionnaires d'interpolation intermédiaires. Tween hérite de BaseTween.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.PlaybackSta.documentation: PlaybackState décrit l'étape actuelle de l'animationTween `. UN la description de chaque État peut être trouvée sur la page du ÉnumérationEnum.PlaybackState. Il peut être manipulé par d'autresTween fonctions, comme «Tween /Play |Play.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Cancel/para.documentation: Classe de base abstraite pour les gestionnaires d'interpolation intermédiaires. Tween hérite de BaseTween.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Cancel.documentation: La fonction Cancel arrête la lecture de son Tween et réinitialise l'interpolation variables. Si TweenBase:Play est appelé à nouveau, les propriétés deTween `` reprendra l'interpolation vers leur destination mais, comme l'interpolation les variables ont été réinitialisées, utilisez toute la longueur de l'animation pour le faire.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Pause/param.documentation: Classe de base abstraite pour les gestionnaires d'interpolation intermédiaires. Tween hérite de BaseTween.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Pause.documentation: La fonction Pause arrête la lecture de son Tween. Si TweenBase.Resume est appelée à nouveau, l'interpolation reprendra la lecture à partir du moment où elle a été mise en pause.
@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Pause.code_sample:
local TweenService = game:GetService("TweenService")
 
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 10, 0)
part.Anchored = true
part.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright green")
part.Parent = game.Workspace
 
local goal = {}
goal.Position = Vector3.new(50, 10, 0)
 
local tweenInfo = TweenInfo.new(10, Enum.EasingStyle.Linear)
 
local tween = TweenService:Create(part, tweenInfo, goal)
 
tween:Play()
 
wait(3)
part.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright red")
tween:Pause()
 
wait(2)
part.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright green")
tween:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Play/param/.documentation: Classe de base abstraite pour les gestionnaires d'interpolation intermédiaires. Tween hérite de BaseTween.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Play.documentation: La fonction Play lance la lecture de son Tween. Notez que si une interpolation a déjà commencé à appeler Play n'aura aucun effet sauf si l'interpolation terminé ou a été arrêté (soit parTweenBase /Cancelsoit TweenBase:Pause).
@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Play.code_sample:
local TweenService = game:GetService("TweenService")
 
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 10, 0)
part.Color = Color3.new(1, 0, 0)
part.Anchored = true
part.Parent = game.Workspace
 
local goal = {}
goal.Position = Vector3.new(10, 10, 0)
goal.Color = Color3.new(0, 1, 0)
 
local tweenInfo = TweenInfo.new(5)
 
local tween = TweenService:Create(part, tweenInfo, goal)
 
tween:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Completed.C.documentation: Objet qui exécute des fonctions connectées lors d'une occurrence spécifique.
Connecte la fonction donnée à l'événement et renvoie un RBXScriptConnection qui le représente.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Completed.W.documentation:
Donne le thread actuel jusqu'à ce que le signal soit déclenché et renvoie les arguments
fourni par le signal.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Completed.documentation: L'événement Completed d'un Tween se déclenche lorsque l'interpolation finit de jouer. Cela se produit soit lorsque l'interpolation finit naturellement de jouer, soit si il est arrêté avec «TweenBase /Cancel ».

@roblox/globaltype/TweenService.documentation: TweenService is used to create Tweens, which are used to interpolate, or tween, the properties of instances. Tweens can be used on any object with compatible property types.
@roblox/globaltype/TweenService.code_sample:
local TweenService = game:GetService("TweenService")
 
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 10, 0)
part.Color = Color3.new(1, 0, 0)
part.Anchored = true
part.Parent = game.Workspace
 
local goal = {}
goal.Position = Vector3.new(10, 10, 0)
goal.Color = Color3.new(0, 1, 0)
 
local tweenInfo = TweenInfo.new(5)
 
local tween = TweenService:Create(part, tweenInfo, goal)
 
tween:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/TweenService.Create/p.documentation: TweenService is used to create Tweens, which are used to interpolate, or tween, the properties of instances. Tweens can be used on any object with compatible property types.
The Instance whose properties are to be tweened.
A dictionary of properties, and their target values, to be tweened.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenService.Create.documentation: Creates a new Tween given the object whose properties are to be tweened, a datatype.TweenInfo and a dictionary of goal property values.
@roblox/globaltype/TweenService.Create.code_sample:
local TweenService = game:GetService("TweenService")
 
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 10, 0)
part.Color = Color3.new(1, 0, 0)
part.Anchored = true
part.Parent = game.Workspace
 
local goal = {}
goal.Position = Vector3.new(10, 10, 0)
goal.Color = Color3.new(0, 1, 0)
 
local tweenInfo = TweenInfo.new(5)
 
local tween = TweenService:Create(part, tweenInfo, goal)
 
tween:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/TweenService.GetValue.documentation: TweenService is used to create Tweens, which are used to interpolate, or tween, the properties of instances. Tweens can be used on any object with compatible property types.
A new alpha value generated from the given easing style and direction
Calculates a new alpha given an Enum.EasingStyle and Enum.EasingDirection

@roblox/globaltype/UIAspectRatioConstrai.documentation: Ensures the parent UI element maintains a particular aspect ratio.
Determines the width-to-height ratio to be maintained by the constraint.
Determines what limits the maximum size of the UI element.
Determines the axis to use when setting the new size of the UI element.

@roblox/globaltype/UIBase.documentation: UIBaseest la classe de base des classes de contraintes et de mise en page d'interface utilisateur

@roblox/globaltype/UIComponent.documentation: A base class for UI constraint and layout classes, inherits from UiBase.

@roblox/globaltype/UIConstraint.documentation: Classe de base pour les classes de contraintes d'interface utilisateur.

@roblox/globaltype/UICorner.documentation: A UIComponent that will apply deformation to shapes of corners of its parent GuiObject

@roblox/globaltype/UICorner.CornerRadius.documentation: Determines the radius, in pixels, of the UICorner UIComponent

@roblox/globaltype/UIGradient.documentation: A UIComponent, that blends a color gradient to its parent GuiObject, so you can layer multiple colors into your text, UI background or other UI content.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGradient.Color.documentation: Determines the color blended with the parent GuiObject along the length of the gradient

@roblox/globaltype/UIGradient.Enabled.documentation: Whether the gradient is enabled or not.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGradient.Offset.documentation: Determines the scalar translation of the gradient from the center of the parent GuiObject.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGradient.Rotation.documentation: Determines the clockwise rotation in degrees of the gradient starting from left to right.
@roblox/globaltype/UIGradient.Rotation.code_sample:
local ROTATE_SPEED = 90 -- degrees per second
local uiGradient = script.Parent
local RunService = game:GetService("RunService")
 
local function onRenderStep(deltaTime)
    local currentRotation = uiGradient.Rotation
    uiGradient.Rotation = (currentRotation + ROTATE_SPEED * deltaTime) % 360
end
RunService.RenderStepped:Connect(onRenderStep)

@roblox/globaltype/UIGradient.Transparen.documentation: Determines how much the parent GuiObject can be seen through along the length of the gradient

@roblox/globaltype/UIGridLayout.documentation: Positions sibling UI elements by filling rows using the space of the parent UI element

@roblox/globaltype/UIGridLayout.CellPadd.documentation: Determines how much space there is between elements in the grid.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGridLayout.CellSize.documentation: Determines the size of each element in the grid.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGridLayout.FillDire.documentation: Determines the maximum number of cells that may be used in a row or column before before the next one is started.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGridLayout.StartCor.documentation: Determines from which corner the grid starts laying out UI elements.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGridStyleLayout.documentation: The base class for grid style UI layouts.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGridStyleLayout.Abs.documentation: The absolute size of space being taken up by the grid layout.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGridStyleLayout.Fil.documentation: Determines the axis in which UI elements are laid out.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGridStyleLayout.Hor.documentation: Determines the horizontal alignment of UI elements within the parent element.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGridStyleLayout.Sor.documentation: Determines the manner in which the next UI element is chosen when being laid out.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGridStyleLayout.Ver.documentation: Determines the vertical alignment of UI elements within the parent element.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGridStyleLayout.App.documentation: The base class for grid style UI layouts.
Force re-layout of subling UI elements.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGridStyleLayout.Set.documentation: The base class for grid style UI layouts.
Sets the function used to determine the order of elements when SortOrder is set to Custom.

@roblox/globaltype/UIInlineLayout.documentation: Aligns and renders text-based UI elements inline for the purposes of rich text formatting.

@roblox/globaltype/UILayout.documentation: The base class for UI layout classes.

@roblox/globaltype/UIListLayout.documentation: Positions sibling UI elements in a single row.

@roblox/globaltype/UIListLayout.Padding.documentation: Determines the amount of free space between each element.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPadding.PaddingBott.documentation:
Le rembourrage à appliquer sur la face inférieure par rapport à la normale du parent
taille.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPadding.PaddingLeft.documentation:
Le rembourrage à appliquer sur le côté gauche par rapport à la normale du parent
taille.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPadding.PaddingRigh.documentation:
Le rembourrage à appliquer sur le côté droit par rapport à la normale du parent
taille.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPadding.PaddingTop.documentation: Le rembourrage à appliquer sur le dessus par rapport à la taille normale du parent.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.Animated.documentation: Whether or not to animate transitions between pages.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.Circular.documentation: Whether or not the page layout wraps around at the ends.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.CurrentP.documentation: The page that is either currently being displayed or is the target of the current animation.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.EasingDi.documentation: The easing direction to use when performing an animation.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.EasingSt.documentation: The easing style to use when performing an animation.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.GamepadI.documentation: Controls the overrides of NextSelection{Up, Down, Left, Right}. Defaults to true.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.Padding.documentation: Determines the amount that pages are separated from each other by.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.ScrollWh.documentation: Controls the use of scroll wheel, in case that it is intended for something else. Defaults to true.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.TouchInp.documentation: Controls touch scrolling, in case this is a non-interactive layout. Defaults to true.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.JumpTo.documentation: If the page is in the UIPageLayout, then it sets UIPageLayout.CurrentPage to it and animates to it. If the circular layout is enabled, it will take the shortest path to this page.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.JumpToIn.documentation: If the index is >= 0 and less than the size of the layout, this method acts like UIPageLayout:JumpTo. If it's out of bounds and circular is set, it will animate the full distance between the in-bounds index of UIPageLayout.CurrentPage and the new index.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.Next.documentation: Sets UIPageLayout.CurrentPage to the page after the current page and animates to it, or does nothing if there isn't a next page.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.Previous.documentation: Sets UIPageLayout.CurrentPage to the page before the current page and animates to it, or does nothing if there isn't a previous page.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.PageEnte.documentation: Objet qui exécute des fonctions connectées lors d'une occurrence spécifique.
Connecte la fonction donnée à l'événement et renvoie un RBXScriptConnection qui le représente.

Donne le thread actuel jusqu'à ce que le signal soit déclenché et renvoie les arguments
fourni par le signal.
Fires when a page comes into view, and is going to be rendered.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.PageLeav.documentation: Objet qui exécute des fonctions connectées lors d'une occurrence spécifique.
Connecte la fonction donnée à l'événement et renvoie un RBXScriptConnection qui le représente.

Donne le thread actuel jusqu'à ce que le signal soit déclenché et renvoie les arguments
fourni par le signal.
Fires when a page leaves view, and will not be rendered.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.Stopped..documentation: Objet qui exécute des fonctions connectées lors d'une occurrence spécifique.
Connecte la fonction donnée à l'événement et renvoie un RBXScriptConnection qui le représente.

Donne le thread actuel jusqu'à ce que le signal soit déclenché et renvoie les arguments
fourni par le signal.

@roblox/globaltype/UIPageLayout.Stopped.documentation: Fires when an animation to UIPageLayout.CurrentPage is completed without being canceled, and the view stops scrolling.

@roblox/globaltype/UIScale.documentation: An object that acts as a multiplier for the size of the parent UI element's scale.

@roblox/globaltype/UIScale.Scale.documentation: Determines the multiplier to apply to the parent UI element's size.

@roblox/globaltype/UISizeConstraint.documentation: Ensures a GuiObject does not become larger or smaller than the constraint's max size or min size.
@roblox/globaltype/UISizeConstraint.code_sample:
-- Create a ScreenGui container for the Frame
local ScreenGui = Instance.new("ScreenGui")
ScreenGui.Parent = game.StarterGui

-- Create the frame
local frame = Instance.new("Frame")
frame.Parent = ScreenGui
frame.Size = UDim2.new(0, 400, 0, 400)

-- Create the UISizeConstraint
local constraint = Instance.new("UISizeConstraint")
constraint.Parent = frame
constraint.MaxSize = Vector2.new(250, 250)
constraint.MinSize = Vector2.new(50, 50)

@roblox/globaltype/UISizeConstraint.MaxS.documentation: The largest size in pixels the object is allowed to be.

@roblox/globaltype/UISizeConstraint.MinS.documentation: The smallest size in pixels the object is allowed to be.

@roblox/globaltype/UIStroke.documentation: Applique un contourtext ou une bordure d'interface utilisateur.

@roblox/globaltype/UIStroke.ApplyStrokeM.documentation:
Détermine s'il faut appliquer le contour à la bordure de l'objet au lieu de
textlui-même.

@roblox/globaltype/UIStroke.Enabled.documentation: Détermine si le trait est visible.

@roblox/globaltype/UIStroke.LineJoinMode.documentation: Détermine comment les angles sont interprétés.

@roblox/globaltype/UIStroke.Transparency.documentation: Définit l'opacité du trait indépendamment de celle de l'objet parent GUIObject.BackgroundTransparencyTextLabel/TextTransparency|TextTransparency`.

@roblox/globaltype/UITableLayout.documentation: Lays out sibling UI elements and their child UI elements as rows/columns and cells in a table.

@roblox/globaltype/UITableLayout.FillEmp.documentation: Determines whether cells are sized such that they occupy the horizontal space of the parent UI element.
Determines whether cells are sized such that they occupy the vertical space of the parent UI element.

@roblox/globaltype/UITableLayout.MajorAx.documentation: Determines whether sibling UI elements are treated as rows or columns.

@roblox/globaltype/UITableLayout.Padding.documentation: Determines the empty space between cells.

@roblox/globaltype/UITextSizeConstraint.documentation: Ensures that the size of text rendered by certain GuiObject classes lies within the range described by UITextSizeConstraint.MaxTextSize and UITextSizeConstraint.MinTextSize

@roblox/globaltype/UITextSizeConstraint..documentation: The largest size in pixels the font is allowed to be
The smallest size in pixels the font is allowed to be

@roblox/globaltype/UnionOperation.documentation: Combines parts together into a single solid model

@roblox/globaltype/UniversalConstraint.documentation: A constraint that maintains a perpendicular angle between two axes of two attachments
@roblox/globaltype/UniversalConstraint.code_sample:
local BodyA=Instance.new("Part", workspace)
BodyA.Size=Vector3.new(1,1,1)
BodyA.Position=Vector3.new(2,10,1)
BodyA.CanCollide=false
BodyA.Anchored=true
local BodyB=Instance.new("Part", workspace)
BodyB.Size=Vector3.new(1,1,1)
BodyB.Position=Vector3.new(-2,10,1)
BodyB.CanCollide=false
-- set other properties of the parts ...

local attachmentA = Instance.new("Attachment", BodyA)
attachmentA.Position=Vector3.new(-1,0,0)
attachmentA.Axis=Vector3.new(-1,0,0)
attachmentA.SecondaryAxis=Vector3.new(0,0,1)
local attachmentB = Instance.new("Attachment", BodyB)
attachmentB.Position=Vector3.new(1,0,0)
attachmentB.Axis=Vector3.new(-1,0,0)
attachmentB.SecondaryAxis=Vector3.new(0,1,0)
-- set other properties of the attachments ...


-- Create a universal constraint
local universalConstraint = Instance.new("UniversalConstraint")
universalConstraint.Parent = BodyA
universalConstraint.Attachment0=attachmentA
universalConstraint.Attachment1=attachmentB

@roblox/globaltype/UniversalConstraint.L.documentation: Determines whether the angular motion of attachments’ primary axes is limited

@roblox/globaltype/UniversalConstraint.M.documentation: The max angle, in degrees, of the constraint’s limiting cone

@roblox/globaltype/UniversalConstraint.R.documentation: The restitution coefficient of the cone constraint

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.documentation: The UserGameSettings is a singleton class found inside of the UserSettings singleton. It holds various persistent settings relating to how the user wants to control their camera, and their character.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.Comp.documentation: The camera movement mode currently in-use by the client.
The movement type in-use by the client via Computer input.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.Cont.documentation: Toggles whether or not the client can use the Mouse Lock Switch mode.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.Game.documentation: Describes how sensitive the camera is when using a gamepad.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.Mast.documentation: A float between 0 and 1 representing the volume of the game's client.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.Mous.documentation: A float representing the sensitivity of the client's mouse.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.Rota.documentation: Controls how the client's character is rotated.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.Save.documentation: The graphics quality level set by the client.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.Touc.documentation: The camera type in-use by the client while on a mobile device.
The type of controls being used by the client on a mobile device.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.GetC.documentation: The UserGameSettings is a singleton class found inside of the UserSettings singleton. It holds various persistent settings relating to how the user wants to control their camera, and their character.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.GetO.documentation: The UserGameSettings is a singleton class found inside of the UserSettings singleton. It holds various persistent settings relating to how the user wants to control their camera, and their character.
The onboarding ID to inquire about
Whether or not the onboarding in particular has been completed yet
Checks if onboarding has been completed

Returns true if the user's Roblox window is in full screen mode.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.InSt.documentation: The UserGameSettings is a singleton class found inside of the UserSettings singleton. It holds various persistent settings relating to how the user wants to control their camera, and their character.
Returns true if the client's game session is in Roblox Studio.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.SetC.documentation: The UserGameSettings is a singleton class found inside of the UserSettings singleton. It holds various persistent settings relating to how the user wants to control their camera, and their character.
If called, Roblox toggles the menu option to invert the user's camera y axis.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.SetG.documentation: The UserGameSettings is a singleton class found inside of the UserSettings singleton. It holds various persistent settings relating to how the user wants to control their camera, and their character.
If called, Roblox toggles the menu option to control the camera sensitivity with gamepads.

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.SetO.documentation: The UserGameSettings is a singleton class found inside of the UserSettings singleton. It holds various persistent settings relating to how the user wants to control their camera, and their character.
The onboarding ID to set as completed

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.Full.documentation: Objet qui exécute des fonctions connectées lors d'une occurrence spécifique.
Connecte la fonction donnée à l'événement et renvoie un RBXScriptConnection qui le représente.

Donne le thread actuel jusqu'à ce que le signal soit déclenché et renvoie les arguments
fourni par le signal.
Fires if the user's full screen mode is changed.
@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.Full.code_sample:
local GameSettings = UserSettings().GameSettings

local function checkFullScreenMode()
	local inFullscreen = GameSettings:InFullScreen()
	if inFullscreen then
		print("Full Screen mode enabled!")
	else
		print("Full Screen mode disabled!")
	end
end

checkFullScreenMode()
GameSettings.FullscreenChanged:Connect(checkFullScreenMode)

@roblox/globaltype/UserGameSettings.Stud.documentation: Objet qui exécute des fonctions connectées lors d'une occurrence spécifique.
Connecte la fonction donnée à l'événement et renvoie un RBXScriptConnection qui le représente.

Donne le thread actuel jusqu'à ce que le signal soit déclenché et renvoie les arguments
fourni par le signal.
Fired when the user's client switches between studio mode and in-game mode. This gets fired periodically in Roblox Studio when a session starts.

@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.documentation: The UserInputService is a service used to detect the type of input available on a user's device via the use of a LocalScript. The service is also used to detect input events
@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.code_sample:
-- We must get the UserInputService before we can use it
local UserInputService = game:GetService("UserInputService")

-- A sample function providing one usage of InputBegan
local function onInputBegan(input, gameProcessed)
	if input.UserInputType == Enum.UserInputType.MouseButton1 then
		print("The left mouse button has been pressed!")
	end
end

UserInputService.InputBegan:Connect(onInputBegan)

@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.Acce.documentation: Describes whether the user's device has an accelerometer
@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.Acce.code_sample:
local UserInputService = game:GetService("UserInputService")

local Ball = game.Workspace.Ball
local RealGravity = Instance.new("BodyForce", Ball)
local AntiGravity = Instance.new("BodyForce", Ball)
AntiGravity.force = Vector3.new(0, 196.2 * Ball:GetMass(), 0)

local function MoveBall(gravity)
	RealGravity.force = gravity.Position * 196.2 * game.Workspace.Ball:GetMass()
end

if UserInputService.AccelerometerEnabled then
	UserInputService.DeviceGravityChanged:Connect(MoveBall)	
end

@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.Mous.documentation: Determines whether the user’s mouse can be moved freely or is locked
Scales the delta (change) output of the user's Mouse
Describes whether the user’s device has a mouse available
Determines whether the Mouse icon is visible
@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.Mous.code_sample:
local UserInputService = game:GetService("UserInputService")

local mouseInput =
{
	Enum.UserInputType.MouseButton1,
	Enum.UserInputType.MouseButton2,
	Enum.UserInputType.MouseButton3,
	Enum.UserInputType.MouseMovement,
	Enum.UserInputType.MouseWheel	
}

local keyboard = Enum.UserInputType.Keyboard

local function ToggleMouse(lastInputType)
	if lastInputType == keyboard then
		UserInputService.MouseIconEnabled = false
		return
	end
	
	for i, mouse in pairs (mouseInput) do
		if lastInputType == mouse then
			UserInputService.MouseIconEnabled = true
			return
		end
	end
end

UserInputService.LastInputTypeChanged:Connect(ToggleMouse)

Determines the size of the on-screen keyboard

@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.Touc.documentation: Describes whether the user’s current device has a touch-screen available

@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.VREn.documentation: Indicates whether the user is using a virtual reality headset
@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.VREn.code_sample:
local UserInputService = game:GetService("UserInputService")

local players = game:GetService("Players")
local player = players.LocalPlayer
local character = player.CharacterAdded:Wait()
local head = character:WaitForChild("Head")

local function TrackHead(inputType, value)
	if inputType == Enum.UserCFrame.Head then
		head.CFrame = value
	end
end

if UserInputService.VREnabled then
	-- Set the inital CFrame
	head.CFrame = UserInputService:GetUserCFrame(Enum.UserCFrame.Head)
	
	-- Track VR headset movement and mirror for character's head
	UserInputService.UserCFrameChanged:Connect(TrackHead)
end

@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.Game.code_sample:
local UserInputService = game:GetService("UserInputService")
local ContextActionService = game:GetService("ContextActionService")

local controller = Enum.UserInputType.Gamepad1
local buttonX = Enum.KeyCode.ButtonX

local function isSupported(gamepad, keycode)
	return UserInputService:GamepadSupports(gamepad, keycode)
end

local function action()
	print("Action")
end

if isSupported(controller, buttonX) then
	ContextActionService:BindAction("sample action", action, false, buttonX)
end

@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.GetD.documentation: The UserInputService is a service used to detect the type of input available on a user's device via the use of a LocalScript. The service is also used to detect input events
Returns an InputObject that describes the device's current acceleration
The UserInputService is a service used to detect the type of input available on a user's device via the use of a LocalScript. The service is also used to detect input events
Returns an InputObject describing the device's current gravity vector
@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.GetD.code_sample:
-- Make variable for UserInputService
local UserInputService = game:GetService("UserInputService")
 
-- Make variables for game objects
local label = script.Parent
local bubble = game.Workspace.Bubble
local camera = game.Workspace.CurrentCamera
 
-- Fix camera above level
camera.CameraType = Enum.CameraType.Scriptable
camera.CoordinateFrame = CFrame.new(Vector3.new(0,20,0), Vector3.new(0,0,0))
 
-- Check if user's device supports accelerometer
if UserInputService.GyroscopeEnabled then
	-- Bind event to when gyroscope detects change
	UserInputService.DeviceGravityChanged:Connect(function(accel)
		-- Display accelerometer output to a TextLabel
		label.Text = string.format("%.2f", accel.Position.X) .. "\n" ..
					 string.format("%.2f", accel.Position.Y) .. "\n" ..
					 string.format("%.2f", accel.Position.Z)
		-- Move the bubble in the world based on the gyroscope data
		bubble.Position = Vector3.new(0, 1.8, - 8 * accel.Position.Z)
	end)
else
	-- Kindly turn away users who do not have an gyroscope
	local message = Instance.new("Message", game.Players.LocalPlayer.PlayerGui)
	message.Text = "This game only works on a device with a gyroscope."
end

local _states = UserInputService:GetGamepadState(Enum.UserInputType.Gamepad1)

	states[state.KeyCode] = state

@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.GetM.documentation: The UserInputService is a service used to detect the type of input available on a user's device via the use of a LocalScript. The service is also used to detect input events
An array of InputObject corresponding to the mouse buttons currently being currently held down
Returns an array of InputObject corresponding with the mouse buttons currently being held down
@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.GetM.code_sample:
local UserInputService = game:GetService("UserInputService")

-- InputBegan is a UserInputService event that fires when the player
-- begins interacting via a Human-User input device
UserInputService.InputBegan:Connect(function(input, gameProcessedEvent)
-- Returns an array of the pressed MouseButtons
local buttons = UserInputService:GetMouseButtonsPressed()

	local m1Pressed, m2Pressed = false, false
	for _, button in pairs (buttons) do
		-- Check if MouseButton1 is pressed
		if (button.UserInputType.Name == "MouseButton1") then
			print("MouseButton1 is pressed")
			m1Pressed = true
		end

		-- Check if MouseButton2 is pressed
		if (button.UserInputType.Name == "MouseButton2") then
			print("MouseButton2 is pressed")
			m2Pressed = true
		end
		
		-- Check if both MouseButton1 and MouseButton2 are pressed
		if (m1Pressed and m2Pressed) then
			print("Both mouse buttons are pressed")
		end
	end
end)

@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.GetM.code_sample:
local UserInputService = game:GetService("UserInputService")
local RunService = game:GetService("RunService")
local gui = script.Parent
local screenGui = gui.Parent
screenGui.IgnoreGuiInset = true
mouseLocation = UserInputService:GetMouseLocation()
gui.Position = UDim2.fromOffset(mouseLocation.X, mouseLocation.Y)
local function moveGuiToMouse()
	mouseLocation = UserInputService:GetMouseLocation()
	gui.Position = UDim2.fromOffset(mouseLocation.X, mouseLocation.Y)
end

RunService:BindToRenderStep("moveGuiToMouse", 1, moveGuiToMouse)

-- Services
local userInputService = game:GetService("UserInputService")
local players = game:GetService("Players")

-- Local player

local character = player.CharacterAdded:Wait()

end

userInputService.JumpRequest:Connect(Jump)

fourni par le signal.
Fires when a user taps the game world on a UserInputService.TouchEnabled device - such as the screen of a mobile device
@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.Touc.code_sample:
local UserInputService = game:GetService("UserInputService")

local camera = game.Workspace.CurrentCamera
local length = 500

local function createPart(position, processedByUI)
	-- Do not create a part if the player clicked on a GUI/UI element
	if processedByUI then return end

	-- Get Vector3 world position from the Vector2 viewport position
	local unitRay = camera:ViewportPointToRay(position.X, position.Y)
	local ray = Ray.new(unitRay.Origin, unitRay.Direction * length)
	local hitPart, worldPosition = game.Workspace:FindPartOnRay(ray)
	
	-- Create a new part at the world position if the player clicked on a part
	-- Do not create a new part if player clicks on empty skybox
	if hitPart then
		local part = Instance.new("Part")
		part.Parent = game.Workspace
		part.Anchored = true
		part.Size = Vector3.new(1, 1, 1)
		part.Position = worldPosition
	end
end

UserInputService.TouchTapInWorld:Connect(createPart)

@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.User.documentation: Objet qui exécute des fonctions connectées lors d'une occurrence spécifique.

Fires when the DataType.CFrame of a specified Virtual Reality device changes
@roblox/globaltype/UserInputService.User.code_sample:
local UserInputService = game:GetService("UserInputService")

local players = game:GetService("Players")
local player = players.LocalPlayer
local character = player.CharacterAdded:Wait()
local head = character:WaitForChild("Head")

local function TrackHead(inputType, value)
	if inputType == Enum.UserCFrame.Head then
		head.CFrame = value
	end
end

if UserInputService.VREnabled then
	-- Set the inital CFrame
	head.CFrame = UserInputService:GetUserCFrame(Enum.UserCFrame.Head)
	
	-- Track VR headset movement and mirror for character's head
	UserInputService.UserCFrameChanged:Connect(TrackHead)
end

An array of dictionary objects that contain the user's names
Returns an array of user information including user name and display name.
@roblox/globaltype/UserService.GetUserIn.code_sample:
local success, result = pcall(function()
	return Players:GetUserInfosByUserIdsAsync({ 8000 })
end)

if success then
	for _, userInfo in ipairs(result) do
		print("Id:", userInfo.Id)
		print("Username:", userInfo.Username)
		print("DisplayName:", userInfo.DisplayName)
	end
else
	-- an error occurred
end

--> Id: 8000
--> Username: player1
--> DisplayName: player1

@roblox/globaltype/Vector3Value.documentation: A container object for a single Vector3 value.
@roblox/globaltype/Vector3Value.code_sample:
-- Paste me in a Script inside a Part
local part = script.Parent
-- A Vector3Value to hold the Teleport target position
-- Tip: Prefix variables of "Value-" objects with "v"
local vTeleportPosition = part.TeleportPosition 

local function onTouch(otherPart)
	-- First, find the HumanoidRootPart. If we can't find it, exit.
	local hrp = otherPart.Parent:FindFirstChild("HumanoidRootPart")
	if not hrp then return end
	
	-- Now teleport by setting the CFrame to one created from
	-- the stored in TeleportPosition
	hrp.CFrame = CFrame.new(vTeleportPosition.Value)
end

part.Touched:Connect(onTouch)

Connecte la fonction donnée à l'événement et renvoie un RBXScriptConnection qui le représente.

Donne le thread actuel jusqu'à ce que le signal soit déclenché et renvoie les arguments
fourni par le signal.
Déclenché lorsque la navigation est demandée par leVRService.
@roblox/globaltype/VRService.NavigationR.code_sample:
local VRService = game:GetService("VRService")

VRService.TouchpadModeChanged:Connect(function(cframe, inputUserCFrame)
	print(inputUserCFrame.Name + " made request with CFrame: " + cframe)
end)

@roblox/globaltype/VRService.TouchpadMod.documentation: Objet qui exécute des fonctions connectées lors d'une occurrence spécifique.
Connecte la fonction donnée à l'événement et renvoie un RBXScriptConnection qui le représente.

Donne le thread actuel jusqu'à ce que le signal soit déclenché et renvoie les arguments
fourni par le signal.
Se déclenche si le VRTouchPadMode d'un VRTouchpad est modifié.
@roblox/globaltype/VRService.TouchpadMod.code_sample:
local VRService = game:GetService("VRService")

VRService.NavigationRequested:Connect(function(pad, mode)
	print(pad.Name + "Touchpad changed to state: " + mode.Name)
end)

@roblox/globaltype/VRService.UserCFrameC.documentation: Objet qui exécute des fonctions connectées lors d'une occurrence spécifique.
Connecte la fonction donnée à l'événement et renvoie un RBXScriptConnection qui le représente.

Donne le thread actuel jusqu'à ce que le signal soit déclenché et renvoie les arguments
fourni par le signal.

@roblox/globaltype/VRService.UserCFrameC.code_sample:
local VRService = game:GetService("VRService")

VRService.UserCFrameChanged(function(type, value)
	print(type.Name + " changed. Updated Frame: " + value)
end

@roblox/globaltype/VRService.UserCFrameE.documentation: Objet qui exécute des fonctions connectées lors d'une occurrence spécifique.
Connecte la fonction donnée à l'événement et renvoie un RBXScriptConnection qui le représente.

Donne le thread actuel jusqu'à ce que le signal soit déclenché et renvoie les arguments
fourni par le signal.
Se déclenche lorsqu'un UserCFrame est activéenabled ou désactivé.
@roblox/globaltype/VRService.UserCFrameE.code_sample:
local VRService = game:GetService("VRService")

VRService.UserCFrameEnabled:Connect(function(type, enabled)
	if (enabled) then
		print(type.Name + " got enabled!")
	else
		print(type.Name + " got disabled!")
end)

@roblox/globaltype/WeldConstraint.documentation: Joins two BasePart together such that their relative position and orientation remain the same.

@roblox/globaltype/WeldConstraint.Active.documentation: Indicates if the WeldConstraint is currently active in the world

@roblox/globaltype/WeldConstraint.Enable.documentation: Toggles the constraint on and off.

@roblox/globaltype/WeldConstraint.Part0.documentation: The first part connected by the constraint.

@roblox/globaltype/WeldConstraint.Part1.documentation: The second part connected by the constraint.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.documentation: The Workspace is the service in which any objects that are to be rendered in the 3D world exist. Objects not descending from Workspace will not be rendered or physically interact with the world

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.AllowThirdP.documentation: Determines whether assets created by other uses can be sold in the game.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.CurrentCame.documentation: The Camera object being used by the local player.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.Distributed.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, that the game has been running.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.FallenParts.documentation: Determines the height at which falling BasePart (and their ancestor Model) are destroyed

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.Gravity.documentation: Determines the acceleration due to gravity applied to falling BaseParts.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.PhysicsStep.documentation: Sets how the solver will advance the physics simulation forward in time.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.StreamingEn.documentation: Whether content streaming is enabled for the place

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.StreamingMi.documentation: Minimum distance that content will be streamed to players with high priority

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.StreamingPa.documentation: Whether streaming physics pause mode is active

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.StreamingTa.documentation: Maximum distance that content will be streamed to players

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.Terrain.documentation: A reference to the Terrain object parented to the Workspace

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.TouchesUseC.documentation: Determines whether BasePart in different groups set to not collide will ignore collisions and touch events

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.FilteringEn.documentation: Determines whether changes made from the client will replicate to the server or not.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.BreakJoints.documentation: The Workspace is the service in which any objects that are to be rendered in the 3D world exist. Objects not descending from Workspace will not be rendered or physically interact with the world
An array of BaseParts for whom joints are to be broken.
Goes through all BaseParts given, breaking any joints connected to these parts.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.Experimenta.documentation: The Workspace is the service in which any objects that are to be rendered in the 3D world exist. Objects not descending from Workspace will not be rendered or physically interact with the world
True if the experimental solver is to be enabled.
Returns true if the game has the PGS Physics solver enabled.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.GetNumAwake.documentation: The Workspace is the service in which any objects that are to be rendered in the 3D world exist. Objects not descending from Workspace will not be rendered or physically interact with the world
Returns the number of BaseParts that are deemed physically active, due to being recently under the influence of physics.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.GetPhysicsT.documentation: The Workspace is the service in which any objects that are to be rendered in the 3D world exist. Objects not descending from Workspace will not be rendered or physically interact with the world
The percentage of real-time that physics simulation is currently being throttled to.
Returns an integer, between 0 and 100, representing the percentage of real-time that physics simulation is currently being throttled to.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.GetRealPhys.documentation: The Workspace is the service in which any objects that are to be rendered in the 3D world exist. Objects not descending from Workspace will not be rendered or physically interact with the world
Returns the number of frames per second that physics is currently being simulated at.
Returns the number of frames per second that physics is currently being simulated at.
@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.GetRealPhys.code_sample:
while wait(1) do
   if Workspace:GetRealPhysicsFPS() > 65 then
      game.Players.LocalPlayer:Kick()
   end
end

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.GetServerTi.documentation: The Workspace is the service in which any objects that are to be rendered in the 3D world exist. Objects not descending from Workspace will not be rendered or physically interact with the world
Returns the server epoch time in seconds

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.JoinToOutsi.documentation: The Workspace is the service in which any objects that are to be rendered in the 3D world exist. Objects not descending from Workspace will not be rendered or physically interact with the world
An array of BaseParts for whom joints are to be made.
The Enum.JointCreationMode to be used. Passing in enum.JointCreationMode or enum.JointCreationMode has the same behavior which equates to Join Always
Creates joints between the specified BasePart and any touching parts depending on the parts' surfaces and the specified joint creation mode.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.MakeJoints/.documentation: The Workspace is the service in which any objects that are to be rendered in the 3D world exist. Objects not descending from Workspace will not be rendered or physically interact with the world
An array of BasePart for whom joints are to be made

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.MakeJoints.documentation: Goes through all BaseParts given. If any part's side has a Enum.SurfaceType that can make a joint it will create a joint with any adjacent parts.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.PGSIsEnable.documentation: The Workspace is the service in which any objects that are to be rendered in the 3D world exist. Objects not descending from Workspace will not be rendered or physically interact with the world
True if the PGS solver is enabled.
Returns true if the game has the PGS Physics solver enabled.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.SetPhysicsT.documentation: The Workspace is the service in which any objects that are to be rendered in the 3D world exist. Objects not descending from Workspace will not be rendered or physically interact with the world
Whether or not physics throttling is enabled.
Determines whether physics throttling is enabled

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.UnjoinFromO.documentation: The Workspace is the service in which any objects that are to be rendered in the 3D world exist. Objects not descending from Workspace will not be rendered or physically interact with the world
An array of BaseParts for whom joints are to be broken.
Breaks all joints between the specified BaseParts and other BaseParts.

@roblox/globaltype/Workspace.ZoomToExten.documentation: The Workspace is the service in which any objects that are to be rendered in the 3D world exist. Objects not descending from Workspace will not be rendered or physically interact with the world
Positions and zooms the Workspace.CurrentCamera to show the extent of BaseParts currently in the Workspace.

@roblox/globaltype/WorldModel.documentation: Provides some physics features to a ViewportFrame

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.ArePartsTou.documentation: A list of parts checks to see if any parts in the list are touching any parts not in the list
The part overlap threshold in studs that is ignored before parts are considered to be touching
True iff any of the Part in partList are touching any other parts (parts not in the partList). False if no parts are passed.
Returns true if any of the given BasePart are touching any other parts
@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.ArePartsTou.code_sample:
-- Create 2 parts that overlap 1 stud
local part1 = Instance.new("Part")
part1.Name = "Part1"
part1.Anchored = true
part1.Parent = workspace
part1.Transparency = 0.5
part1.Color = Color3.new(385, 100, 38)
part1.Size = Vector3.new(2, 2, 2)
part1.Position = Vector3.new(0, 4, 0)

local part2 = Instance.new("Part")
part2.Name = "Part2"
part2.Anchored = true
part2.Parent = workspace
part2.Transparency = 0.5
part2.Color = Color3.new(200, 10, 0)
part2.Size = Vector3.new(2, 2, 2)
part2.Position = Vector3.new(0, 5, 0)

local partList = { part1 }

print(workspace:ArePartsTouchingOthers(partList, 0)) -- True
print(workspace:ArePartsTouchingOthers(partList, 0.999)) -- True
print(workspace:ArePartsTouchingOthers(partList, 1)) -- False

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.BulkMoveTo.documentation: Moves a table of Part to DataType.CFrame in a table of CFrames, without firing property changed events

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.FindPartsIn.documentation: The maximum amount of BaseParts to be returned.
Returns an array of BaseParts in the given DataType.Region3.
@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.FindPartsIn.code_sample:
local Point1 = Vector3.new(0,0,0)
local Point2 = Vector3.new(10,10,10)
local Region = Region3.new(Point1,Point2)
for _,Part in pairs(game.Workspace:FindPartsInRegion3(Region,nil,math.huge)) do
  print(Part.Name)
end

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.FindPartsIn.documentation: An array of objects to be ignored.
The maximum number of BaseParts to be returned.
An array of BaseParts found within the DataType.Region3.
Returns an array of BaseParts in the given DataType.Region3 that aren't in, or a descendant of an entry in, the given IgnoreList.
An array of objects to check.
The maximum number of BaseParts to be returned.
Returns an array of BaseParts in the given DataType.Region3 that are in, or descendant of an object in, a given white list.

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.GetPartBoun.documentation: The location of the center of the given box volume to be queried
The size of the given box volume to be queried
Contains reusable portions of the spatial query parameters
An array of BasePart which matched the spatial query
Returns an array of parts whose bounding boxes overlap a given box
The location of the center of the given sphere volume to be queried
The radius of the given sphere volume to be queried
Contains reusable portions of the spatial query parameters
An array of BasePart which matched the spatial query
Returns an array of parts whose bounding boxes overlap a given sphere

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.GetPartsInP.documentation: The part whose volume is to be checked against other parts
Contains reusable portions of the spatial query parameters
An array of BasePart which matched the spatial query
Returns an array of parts whose occupied space is shared with the given part

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.IKMoveTo/pa.documentation: The location to move the specified part
A number between 0 and 1 specifying how aggressively to match the part's position to the position part of the target DataType.CFrame
A number between 0 and 1 specifying how aggresively to match the part's rotation to to the rotation part of the target DataType.CFrame
Allows you to specify what objects should be effected by the physical resolution

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.IKMoveTo.documentation: Moves the specified part to the specified location via inverse kinematics rather than moving it there directly, to ensure any joints, constraints, or collisions that part is participating in remain physically satisfied

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.IsRegion3Em.documentation: Returns a bool indicating whether there are no BaseParts within the given DataType.Region3.
An array of objects to be ignored.
Returns a bool indicating whether there are no BaseParts within in the given DataType.Region3, ignoring any BaseParts that are descendants of the objects within the given ignore list.

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.Raycast/par.documentation: The origin point of the ray.
The directional vector of the ray. Note that the length of this vector matters, as parts/terrain further away than its length will not be tested.
An object used to specify hit eligibility in the raycast operation. If not provided, default values are used where all parts are considered and Terrain water is not ignored.

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.Raycast/ret.documentation: Contains the results of a raycast operation, or nil if no eligible BasePart or Terrain cell was hit.

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.Raycast.documentation: Casts a ray using an origin, direction, and optional datatype.RaycastParams, then returns a datatype.RaycastResult if an eligible object or terrain intersects the ray.

@roblox/globaltype/WorldRoot.FindPartOnR.documentation: The BasePart or Terrain cell hit, the DataType.Vector3 point of intersection, the DataType.Vector3 surface normal at the point of intersection, and the Enum.Material of the BasePart or terrain cell hit.
Returns the first BasePart or Terrain cell intersecting with the given DataType.Ray

The BasePart or Terrain cell hit, the DataType.Vector3 point of intersection, the DataType.Vector3 surface normal at the point of intersection, and the Enum.Material of the BasePart or terrain cell hit.
Returns the first BasePart or Terrain cell intersecting with the given DataType.Ray that isn't in, nor is a descendant of an object in, the given ignore list

The BasePart or Terrain cell hit, the DataType.Vector3 point of intersection, the DataType.Vector3 surface normal at the point of intersection, and the Enum.Material of the BasePart or terrain cell hit.
Returns the first BasePart or Terrain cell intersecting with the given DataType.Ray that is in, or is a descendant of an object in, the given whitelist

@roblox/globaltype/WrapLayer.documentation: The WrapLayer object defines a 3D accessory’s inner and outer surfaces and other properties related to layering accessories. These surfaces, or the Inner Cage and Outer Cage, are similar to collision boxes, and describe the surfaces of which other 3D accessories can be placed without clipping or breaking.

@roblox/globaltype/WrapLayer.BindOffset.documentation: datatype.CFrame is used to adjust a binding point for clothing item mesh. Could be used to move and rotate clothing items. This property is intended for fine-tuning only and it is heavily optional.

@roblox/globaltype/WrapLayer.Color.documentation: Sets color used for the debug rendering. See WrapTarget.DebugMode

@roblox/globaltype/WrapLayer.DebugMode.documentation: Allows switching between different debugging visualization modes for cage meshes.

@roblox/globaltype/WrapLayer.Enabled.documentation: Allows for disabling of the WrapLayer object as if it does not exist.

@roblox/globaltype/WrapLayer.Order.documentation: Controls the composition order for layered clothing.

@roblox/globaltype/WrapLayer.Puffiness.documentation: Controls how much underlying clothing items inflate the current clothing item.

@roblox/globaltype/WrapLayer.ReferenceMe.documentation: AssetID for reference mesh used to define Inner Cage of a 3D object

@roblox/globaltype/WrapLayer.ReferenceOr.documentation:
Reference mesh offset relative to parent MeshPart (in the parent MeshPart space)
Note: this property is set up automatically by the FBX importer

Reference mesh offset relative to parent MeshPart (in the world space)
Note: this property is set up automatically by the FBX importer

@roblox/globaltype/WrapLayer.ShrinkFacto.documentation: Allows slight shrinking/expanding of the resulting render mesh, without affecting any other layers.

@roblox/globaltype/WrapTarget.documentation:
L'WrapTargetobjet définit une cible. Une cible est le corps 3D avec seulement un
surface extérieure, ou une cage extérieure.

@roblox/globaltype/WrapTarget.Color.documentation: Définit la couleur utilisée pour le rendu de débogage. Consultez WrapTarget.DebugMode.

@roblox/globaltype/WrapTarget.DebugMode.documentation:
Permet de basculer entre différents modes de visualisation de débogage pour la cage
maillages.

@roblox/globaltype/WrapTarget.Stiffness.documentation: Définit dans quelle mesure le mesh du corps peut être comprimé par les vêtements.

@roblox/enum/ActuatorRelativeTo.Attachme.documentation: La contrainte est exprimée par rapport à Attatchment0.
La contrainte est exprimée par rapport à Attatchment1.

@roblox/enum/ActuatorRelativeTo.World.documentation: La contrainte est exprimée par rapport au monde du jeu.

@roblox/enum/ActuatorRelativeTo.documentation: Valeur CFrame dans laquelle la contrainte de déplacement du corps est exprimée.

@roblox/enum/AdornCullingMode.Automatic.documentation: Récupère automatiquement la parure en fonction de la distance.

@roblox/enum/AdornCullingMode.Never.documentation: Neverornement de culls. La parure est toujours visible.

@roblox/enum/AdornCullingMode.documentation: Méthode d'abattage utilisée pour les ornements.

@roblox/enum/AlignType.documentation:
Une énumération qui spécifie la relation entre deux axes. C'est soit parallèle
ou perpendiculairement.

@roblox/enum/AlphaMode.Overlay.documentation: Superpose la SurfaceAppeance.ColorMap sur la partie sous-jacente couleur basée sur le canal alpha de la ColorMap. ! [AlphaModeOverLay] (assets/blt625b6777e66ae841/fern-cutout.png)

@roblox/enum/AlphaMode.Transparency.documentation: Superpose la SurfaceAppeance.ColorMap sur la partie sous-jacente Couleur part.color3 basée sur le canal alpha de ColorMap. ! [AlphaModeTransparency] (assets/bltd194e7f5a88d1fdd/fern-overlay.png).

@roblox/enum/AlphaMode.documentation: Utilisé par SurfaceAppearance/AlphaModepour déterminer comment le canal alpha de la SurfaceAppearance.ColorMap d'une SurfaceAppearance est utilisée.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsEconomyAction.Defa.documentation: Defaultaction. Utilisé pour une action non définie.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsEconomyAction.Acqu.documentation:
Indique l'acquisition d'une ressource en jeu. Par exemple, un joueur
acquiert de la monnaie virtuelle en accomplissant une tâche spécifique en jeu.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsEconomyAction.Spen.documentation:
Indique la dépense ou la perte d'une ressource en jeu. Par exemple, un
le joueur dépense de la monnaie virtuelle pour acquérir un nouvel objet.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsLogLevel.Trace.documentation:
Traceest le niveau le plus bruyant, rarement (voire jamais) activé pour une production
app.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsLogLevel.Error.documentation: Lorsque la fonctionnalité n'est pas disponible ou que les attentes ne sont

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsLogLevel.Fatal.documentation: Au niveau le plus critique,Fatal les événements exigent une attention immédiate.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsProgressionStatus..documentation: Defaultstatut. Utilisé pour un statut non défini.
Indique le début de la progression.
Indique que la progression a échoué.

@roblox/enum/AnalyticsProgressionStatus.documentation:
Cette énumération est utilisée comme argument dans
`AnalyticsService/FireplayerProgressionEvent » pour décrire l'état de
progression.

@roblox/enum/AnimationPriority.Idle.documentation: (6) - Priorité recommandée pour les animations inactives des personnages.

@roblox/enum/AnimationPriority.Movement.documentation:
(5) - Priorité recommandée pour la marche, la course, la natation, l'escalade et autres
animations de locomotion.

@roblox/enum/AnimationPriority.Action.documentation:
(4) - Priorité recommandée pour les actions de caractère qui doivent remplacer idle
et des animations de locomotion.

@roblox/enum/AnimationPriority.Action4.documentation:
(1) -Action4 est la priorité la plus élevée disponible, prévalant sur toutes les autres
valeurs de priorité.

@roblox/enum/AnimationPriority.Core.documentation:
(7) - Priorité la plus basse, destinée à être utilisée par les animations par défaut de Roblox et
ensembles d'animation de catalogue.

@roblox/enum/AnimationPriority.documentation:
L'AnimationPriorityEnum détermine comment la lecture simultanée d'AnimationTracks
contribuer à l'animation finale.

@roblox/enum/AnimatorRetargetingMode.Def.documentation: Retargeting par défaut, opt-in initial mais sujet à modification.

@roblox/enum/ApplyStrokeMode.Contextual.documentation: Le trait est appliqué au texte de l'élément d'interface utilisateur parent.

Donne à l'élément la taille maximale qu'il peut être dans la limite actuelle possible
AbsoluteSize de l'élément tout en conservant le rapport hauteur/largeur.

Met à l'échelle l'élément à la plus grande taille qu'il peut contenir à l'intérieur du parent
la taille maximale de l'élément tout en conservant le rapport hauteur/largeur.

@roblox/enum/AspectType.documentation: Utilisé par UIAspectratioConstraint/AspectTypepour contrôler le comportement de dimensionnement.

@roblox/enum/AssetTypeVerification.Defau.documentation: Utilisez le comportement par défaut pour la vérification du type d'actif.

@roblox/enum/AssetTypeVerification.Clien.documentation: Vérifiez uniquement les types d'actifs sur le client. La vérification du type d'actif ne peut pas être désactivée sur le client.

@roblox/enum/AutomaticSize.X.documentation: Redimensionnez automatiquement l'élément le longX de l'axe pour l'adapter au contenu enfant.

@roblox/enum/AutomaticSize.Y.documentation:
Redimensionnez automatiquement l'élément le longY de l'axe pour l'adapter au contenu enfant. Texte
Les objets ne seront redimensionnés le long de l'Yaxe -axis que si TextWrapped est activé.

@roblox/enum/AutomaticSize.XY.documentation: Redimensionnez automatiquement l'élément le longX et l'Yaxe pour l'adapter au contenu enfant.
